metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3865 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: [ksmbd: fix out-of-bound read in smb2_write] Laurence Wit discovered that the KSMBD implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly validate a buffer size in certain situations, leading to an out-of-bounds read vulnerability. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly expose sensitive information.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
